result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Groth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation  is to be served in Milwaukee County.  Probation review hearing 11/6/2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 40.

miscConds.notes:
Provide biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DV surcharge during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
If probation conditions are successfully completed, Court will grant expungment.

Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
Attend probation review hearing on 11/6/15.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victim, parents are allowed to contact victim for purposes of retrieving storage unit items/his personal possessions.
No contact with firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Court ordered 60 days in HOC, STAYED for the use at the discretion of the probation department (20 days as to each case, this case, 15CM1689 and 15CM2300).
*9/10/2015  Commitment ordered.  To serve 20 days, straight time. No good time credit.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua M Groth not in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent in court. Defendant not in court, but probation review report was good. Court advised agent to schedule further review with the court if needed. No warrant or condition time imposed.

Defendant Joshua M Groth in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (20 days straight time).  rmm
If probation conditions are successfully completed, Court will grant expungement.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve  5 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 5 days served.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so

As to this case, Case# 15CM001689 and 15CM002300:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  2  YEARS with the following conditions:
- Probation is to be served in Milwaukee County
- Court ordered 60 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department. (20 days as to each case)
- Attend and successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim - parents are allowed to contact victim for purposes of retrieving storage unit items/his personal possessions
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DV surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-215.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Joshua M Groth in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Joshua M Groth in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
